page.title: 14BRADFORDS OF ILMINSTER
page.content: This company was formed in 1770 by a family named Bradford. They used to deliver withies. Withies were used for thatching, and they delivered them by horse and cart. They also sold grain and fertiliser for farmers. The firm grew, so now it has fourteen or more branches and subsidiaries based in Somerset, Dorset and Devon. The head office is in Yeovil, and it is still directed and run by the Bradford family. There is a branch in Ilminster which now sells bathroom fittings. They also have a yard selling timber, stone and bricks. From the yard, they deliver locally by lorries. It is possible to buy from Bradfords. All the materials required for building a house.
